sentences: Tosi Mpanu-Mpanu (the Democratic Republic of Congo) co-facilitated the session.
CANADA reported on Wednesday’s spin-offs, noting constructive discussions on the framework for enhanced action, and presenting a list of key aspects of the technology section.
The EU and the US highlighted convergence on the role and importance of technology, cooperative action and anchoring institutions.
Swaziland, for the AFRICAN GROUP, suggested further work on periodic assessments of institutional arrangements through COP decisions.
The EU stated that a COP decision could strengthen institutions, while IRAN preferred doing so in the agreement.
JAPAN called for the framework for enhanced action to be in a COP decision.
INDIA underlined that the agreement could be the “final reinforcement” of the framework and reflect its durability.

The UNITED ARAB EMIRATES said the framework could feature in both the agreement and a COP decision, the former explaining “the what” and the latter “the how.” Co-Facilitator Mpanu-Mpanu encouraged the spin-off to engage in a drafting exercise on cooperative action, the framework and institutions.
